1998: Resident Evil 2, Ocarina of Time, Metal Gear Solid, Baldur's Gate, Starcraft, Medievil, Banjo Kazooie, Grim Fandango...
y, sobretodo Half Life.

Sin ninguna duda, uno de los mejores años de la historia de los videojuegos.



Seguramente todo el mundo conoce a Valve por Steam, pero lo que ha marcado a esta empresa es esta obra maestra que dio un paso muy importante en los shooters en primera persona junto a su segunda parte.

Y es que antes de Half Life, el símbolo de los shooters se centró unicamente en ID Software, creadores de Doom y Wolfestein 3D, los cuales se centraban totalmente en la acción y la jugabilidad, pero dejando de la lado la historia y el argumento. Todo el mundo pensaba en aquel entonces que contar historias en este tipo de juegos sería frenar al jugador y arruinar su experiencia. Todo, hasta que llegó Gordon Freeman y cambió las reglas para siempre.


Half Life buscó la forma de tener un argumento interesante y a la vez mantener una buena jugabilidad la cual el jugador no se aburriera en ningún momento.

El secreto era mantener el jugador dentro de la aventura sin sacarle del control en ningún momento a causa de observar cinemáticas o escenas "scripteadas". Porque si. Half Life es un juego donde el jugador está conectado todo el tiempo. Siempre se mantendrá en la piel de Freeman y todas las escenas de acción las verá a través de sus propios ojos, sin que nada lo desconecte del propio videojuego.

Escenas como las muertes de los científicos fueron parte de una experiencia que nadie había conseguido igualar y dieron una inmersión practicamente perfecta. Es simplemente un juego excelente pensado muy bien diseñado de principio a fin.





Ahora bien, ha pasado mucho tiempo desde 1998 y en estos 20 años hemos podido ver que muchos juegos muy buenos en su día han acabado envejeciendo mal.

En el caso de Half Life, no es una excepción, aunque con un poco de práctica, el juego puede disfrutarse sin problemas. Pero es cierto que, por ejemplo, como no hay un botón de "sprint" pues el personaje corre todo el tiempo y en un juego donde el plataformeo es importante, pues acabas muriendo más por caídas que ser reventado a balazos en dificultad difícil.

De todas formas es cuestión de tener paciencia porque el resto del juego es muy bueno, aunque tengo que admitir que a comparación de otros shooters más modernos (no recientes, hablo de shooters del 2007, por ejemplo) este resulta un tanto confuso, ya sea por su falta de orientación al jugador o porque tiene muchas cosas mal hechas, como las ametrelladoras fijas que son basura.





De todas formas, este juego debería de ser una compra obligatoria para todos los que tengan un PC y tengan Steam (y más cuando se rebaja a 0,81€ en rebajas).

Se trata de uno de estos juegos imprescindibles que aunque parezcan muy genéricos, se nota que han mantenido su personalidad con el paso de los años y han marcado toda una generación.

Por cierto, tiene dos expansiones opcionales. Son historias alternativas a Gordon Freeman: una manejamos a un guardia de seguridad y otra a un marine de los EE.UU. (enemigos de Freeman). Si os gusta el juego y queréis más, pues más contenido para el singleplayer y multiplayer (por cierto si, Half Life tiene multijugador y aún sigue habiendo gente).

Juegazo imprescindible 1000%.

The multi-player is still being played today and you'll be able to find servers, but I'd suggest looking up servers on internet, since there's a bigger choice. Multi-player is a fast-paced deathmatch which requires a lot of skill and patience. Concept is pretty simple, but actually getting good at it is hard. It is kinda like Quake, but HL can be a bit slower at times. Maps are well designed and it's still a fun experience, but I'd suggest finishing the story first, because it's where the real beauty of the game is.

Overrated and dated FPS game with clunky game design. The two Half-Life games are often hailed as masterpieces of the FPS genre and the elusive third game remains one of the most hotly anticipated games. Upon release, the original Half-Life may have seemed revolutionary with regards to some aspects but it has aged terribly and flaws that may have been overlooked at the time are now glaringly obvious.

You play as Gordon Freeman, a theoretical physicist at the Black Mesa complex. Something goes terribly wrong and you find yourself trying to escape the facility while battling hordes of alien creatures.

The game tries to be very cinematic with many heavily scripted sequences including the opening ride through the facility. However, these heavily scripted scenes often mean you are standing around aimlessly waiting for the next area to be accessible.

Half-Life tries to mix things up by being more than just a regular shooter by throwing in some platforming and physics puzzles. However, all this does is damage the pace of the game. As soon as the action gets some rhythm to it, the game grinds to halt as you have to fumble your way across a platforming sequence.

The graphics may have been acceptable at the time but look absolutely awful by today's standards. In fact, I actually cannot play this game for more than fifteen minutes or so at a time without feeling sick. Something about the graphics style of some early 3D games as well as early FPS titles including Duke Nukem 3D and Doom just always seems to give me a headache. Although, I will not hold that against the game, I'm just giving you some context to explain my experience with Half-Life.

I did not get very far because I got frustrated with the bad pacing and irritating puzzles and platforming (as well as the graphics giving me a headache). The shooting is also pretty disappointing.

The main reason I bought the game was to have access to mods. I was mostly interested in the Dragon Ball Z-themed Earth Special Forces, which was okay but somewhat clunky. I have tried some other mods such as Gunman Chronicles and Heart Of Evil: Napalm Edition but was not overly impressed. Some mods for Half-Life including Ricochet and Counter Strike 1.6 can be purchased on Steam independent of Half-Life.

I can see how Half-Life was a big deal when it was released all the way back in 1998. It offered a more complex and cinematic experience than the shooters that came before it such as Wolfenstein 3D, Duke Nukem 3D and Doom. It also must have been a significant stepping stone on the way to later games such as Halo and BioShock.

Half-Life remains a significant part of gaming history because of the engine, the modding community and the fantastic success of Valve. However, as a game itself, I just did not find it remotely fun to play Half-Life.

Maybe it's worth getting for the mods when the game is on sale but otherwise, I really cannot recommend this game. It's a shame because I like some of Valve's other games including CS:GO and the Left 4 Dead series.

Normally, I give games scores but I do not think that I played enough and the personal issue I had with the graphics mean that I probably would be unable to give a fair assessment.

This is an amazing game and helped inspired me to go back to university to study STEM, along with Half Life 2. I can't describe what a classic this game is. Without a doubt, we need a Half Life 3. This game was the jewel of science fiction genre, even more so than classics like Doom and Quake.

This game holds a special place in my heart and it was a lot of fun going back to play it again and beat it.

This game has seriously everything you could ask for in a first person shooter. Huge variety of weaponry, fun and engaging gameplay, a story that is both interesting and doesn't get in the way of the action, and amazing pacing. It's amazing and the graphics have honestly not held this game back from being a lot of fun. The only gripes I have are pretty minor. The whole beginning is reaaallllllllyyyyyyyyy slow and you could honestly step back from the game, go get a coffee from the Starbucks across the street, catch up with a friend, and when you come back, the train section is only halfway through. I will say though that it makes up for it by being amazing and not slowing down the moment it's over. It's also a nice touch to see how Black Mesa functions before aliens start coming and sucking peoples heads. Speaking of aliens, the Xen level is really awe-inspiring but is, in my opinion, the weakest part of the game. I could barely get through it without a guide and every time the game makes me do some platforming, it makes me want to yell Gordon Freeman's mute ass off. The final boss is also meh. Other than that, the rest of the game is glorious. So play it! Experience a story of conspiracy, fight against aliens, military, black-op ninjas, and understand how first-person shooters were influenced by this seminal work. 

TL;DR:
You could kill literally anyone you wanted in this game, even the scientists and guards giving you story stuff. Amazing game. 10/10

What makes this game a classic that has not already been said? Well this game takes the piss out of you, makes my name look meaningless, and at 1st when i did not know what it was and asked "Does Steam have Half Life?" I got the biggest damn wakeup call of my life, between this and its remake black mesa, half life brings out a world of possibilites so great that you never know what will happen next, between "spoilers for anyone who has seriously never played this game before" the headcrabs and the zombies to the hecu and finally xen creatures its an expansive game, and a location that should be the most recognizable computer game location of all time, it brings mystic and curiosity, the marines acting like real humans would, oh are u taking cover, well i guess ill just have to give u some grenades to get you to come out, and while many say xen was shit, in my eyes theres only so much one can do in a years worth of development since valve essentially scrapped everything and started fresh a year in, and i think that xen was a nice addition and change of pace, especially now with black mesa getting its xen maps out the door and into the sunlight, and my words about taking the piss out of players, can be no better surmised then gonarchs lair, since i did not know what i was in for, the shit was scared out of me when the big beast tried to fall upon me, my only criticsm is towards the guns and older graphics which even to modern standards are old, BUT still stand up well enough to me, and also the tau cannon which essentially along with the gluon gun felt mostly useless in the face of the revolver and assualt rifle as well as what the alien grunts hivehands ridiculuos power beheld, i will give this a 9.9 out of 10

[h1] 9/10 [/h1]
Решившись написать обзор на эту игру, я словил себя на мысли, что, даже спустя 20 с лишним лет в первой части Half-Life можно выделить не так уж и много минусов (особенно, если сделать поблажку на то, что игра вышла в 1998 году).
Плюсы: богатый арсенал оружия, интересный сюжет, большое разнообразие врагов, головоломки, ИИ врагов и союзников (который на тот момент был просто прорывным)
Минусы: графика (хотя, что вы ожидаете от игры 1998 года выпуска? И, да, этот пункт включает в себя скайблоки и текстуры низкого качества), низкополигональные модели, звук и, впрочем, всё.
Рекомендую каждому геймеру и особенно фанатам серии.
Лучшая олдскульная игра!

В детстве всегда считал халву скучной дриснёй и предпочитал ей Quake и Doom, а сейчас вот пропёрло перепройти, и даже как-то понравилось. Не то, чтобы я помнил эту игру неправильно, платформинг всё такой же убогий, и стрельба всё такая же неприятная, но общая атмосфера и сюжет зашли в этот раз куда лучше. Видимо, к 26 годам у меня в голове наконец-то образовался мозг, и я смог оценить нарративные достижения игры по достоинству. Жаль, что это мой единственный шаг к самоулучшению за последние 26 лет.

Eu, que não sou muito chegado a fps, não pude deixar de experimentar esse clássico e não me arrependi. Half Life é um jogo de fps em que você controla Gordon Freeman, um cientista que resolve colocar a mão na massa na ativação de um dispositivo em um experimento que acaba dando errado, trazendo diversos alienígenas para o laboratório. Não tendo outra saída, ele deve acabar com os imimigos que tentam matá-lo, sejam aliens ou humanos que tentam fazer uma queima de arquivo para que ninguém saiba do experimento. Mesmo pra quem é ruim em fps, como eu, o jogo ajuda bastante com o lock-in da mira, o que deixa as coisas menos complicadas. Hordas e hordas vêm, e você deve ser ágil o suficiente para desviar dos ataques e manter a defensiva ao mesmo tempo, principalmente nas fases finais. Há monstros que não podem ser exterminados na bala, então observe bastante os arredores para criar estratégias, até mesmo para matar mais de um inimigo por vez. A física desse jogo é excepcional, sem comentários, até hoje é uma referência. Se você gosta de clássicos, fps e de jogos como Doom e Quake, não deixe de jogar essa maravilha, você não vai se arrepender.

Old Classic. (From Valve... you know... the guys from Steam!)
My very first Video / PC Game with real weapons like machine gun and pistol / revolver! Also my very first first-person-shooter (as far as I can remeber :) Back then it was a funny interesting journey / adventure for me. My favourite part of the game are the human world levels, especially fighting against the soldiers. The alien-whatever levels are... nice too but not my favourite. Graphics are old, outdated. But it is a great part of gaming history.
Its Half-Life. The vanguard of what first person shooters would later become or fail to become.
